intro: Serresia, commonly known as the star orchid, is a genus of flowering plants in the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly in countries like South Africa, Namibia, and Botswana. The plants are characterized by their delicate, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. Serresia species typically grow as epiphytes or lithophytes, often found on trees or rocks in arid or semi-arid environments. They have small, strap-like leaves and are known for their unique and striking floral displays.
